required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Effects of INL1 in Patients With Heart Failure and Reduced Ejection Fraction
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Effects of INL1 in Patients With Heart Failure and Reduced Ejection Fraction

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, dose-response trial in patients with chronic stable Heart Failure (HF) and reduced Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) to evaluate the efficacy and safety of three INL1 doses compared with placebo. Patients will be treated for approximately 12 weeks with one of three INL1 doses: 50 mg, 150 mg, 300 mg, or, placebo capsules, taken twice daily (BID).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportional change in N-terminal prohormone of brain natriuretic peptide (NT-proBNP)
primary_outcome.description: Proportional change in N-terminal prohormone of brain natriuretic peptide (NT-proBNP) from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite Heart Failure (HF) Improvement Score
secondary_outcome.description: Composite HF Improvement Score, summarizing changes in 4 HF outcomes (NT-proBNP, left ventricular end-systolic volume [LVESV], NYHA class, and 6 Minute Walk Test) from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Diastolic (LVED)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVED from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic (LVES)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVES from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume (LVEDV)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVEDV from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume (LVESV)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVESV from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Systolic Volume (LVSV)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVSV from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVEF from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Mass (LVM)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVM from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Diastolic Diameter (LVEDD)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVEDD from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Diameter (LVESD)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVESD from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Fractional Shortening (LVFS)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LVFS from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in ratio of mitral peak velocity of early filling (E) to early diastolic mitral annular velocity (E')
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in E/E' ratio from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Atrial Volume (LAV)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in LAV from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Tricuspid Annular Plane Systolic Excursion (TAPSE)
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in TAPSE from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Tricuspid Regurgitation (TR) peak velocity
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in TR peak velocity from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Tricuspid Regurgitation (TR) gradient
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in TR gradient from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Tricuspid Regurgitation (TR) severity
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change in TR severity from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Inferior Vena Cava (IVC) Diameter
secondary_outcome.description: Echocardiogram finding: change IVC Diameter from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in New York Heart Association (NYHA) class
secondary_outcome.description: Change in NYHA class from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 6 minute walk distance
secondary_outcome.description: Change in 6 minute walk distance from Baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QoL) based on Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ) change
secondary_outcome.description: QoL based on change in KCCQ from Baseline to 12 weeks. Quality of Life scale can range from 0 to 100, with higher values indicating a better outcome. Change will be calculated by subtraction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to earliest event among the composite of cardiovascular (CV) death, hospitalization for HF, and unplanned use of intravenous diuretics or intensification of oral diuretic dose
secondary_outcome.description: Time to earliest event among the composite of CV death, hospitalization for HF, and unplanned use of intravenous diuretics or intensification of oral diuretic dose from Baseline to 12 weeks

arm_group.description: INL1 50mg dose to be given twice daily using one 50mg capsule and two matching placebo capsules at each dose
INL1 150mg dose to be given twice daily using three 50mg capsules at each dose
INL1 300mg dose to be given twice daily using three 100mg capsules at each dose
Placebo dose to be given twice daily using 3 placebo capsules at each dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of HF requiring chronic treatment of loop diuretics
- Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) ≤ 40% at screening by echocardiography
- N-Terminal-prohormone of Brain Natriuretic Peptide (NT-proBNP) ≥400 pg/mL at screening for patients without atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter, or, NT-proBNP ≥ 1,200 pg/mL at screening for patients with atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter
- Treated for Heart Failure with stable, optimal pharmacological therapy
- Acceptable screening echocardiographic image quality
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female patients of childbearing potential
- Patients with a New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class I or IV
- Heart failure that is clearly caused by toxin / drug such as Adriamycin
- Significant medical conditions or recent history suggesting the patient's study participation will potentially pose a major risk to patient's safety and well-being
- Need for routine scheduled outpatient IV infusions for Heart Failure or scheduled ultrafiltration
- History of rhabdomyolysis or history of autoimmune diseases
- Severe renal disease
- Hepatic disease
- Pulmonary disease limiting exercise capacity
- Atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response
- Life expectancy of less than 6 months
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus or Type 2 diabetes mellitus with very poor glycemic control
- Patients with anemia
